markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Ankhrav](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2822)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

These horse-sized, burrowing monsters generally avoid heavily settled areas like cities, but ankhravs' predilection for livestock and humanoid flesh ensures that the creatures do not remain in the deep wilderness for long. Desperate farmers whose fields become infested by ankhravs often have little recourse but to seek the aid of adventurers.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Ankhrav.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 3">[Ankhrav](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2822)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Animal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=531" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 20 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +7; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 60 feet

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +6, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +11, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +8

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +4

**Dex** +1

**Con** +3

**Int** -4

**Wis** +0

**Cha** -2
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 18 

**Fort** +12 

**Ref** +8 

**Will** +7 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 40

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, burrow 20 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
mandibles +13 ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3)),
**Damage** 1d8+4 piercing plus 1d6 acid

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
acid spit +10 ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [range 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** 3d6 acid

**Armor-Rending Bite** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The ankhrav makes a mandibles Strike; if the Strike hits, the target's armor takes the damage and the acid damage bypasses the armor's Hardness.

**Spray Acid** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3)) **Frequency** once per hour; **Effect** The ankhrav spews acid in a 30-foot cone, dealing 3d6 acid damage and 1d6 [persistent acid damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) (DC 20 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_3_Locations.png">Ankhrav Burrows</title>

As if the appearance of a hungry ankhrav in a stretch of farmland isn't bad enough, it almost always indicates the proximity of an ankhrav hive nearby. A disturbing number of ankhravs can infest a lair. However, adventurers brave enough to crawl through the tangled burrows are often rewarded with large amounts of treasure, as ankhravs have a habit of dragging their victims back to the deepest corners of their den to feast, usually discarding the remains with most of the gear intact.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-361" />
name: Ankhrav
